segments.text: I think the woman is in her own little world, completely missing the chaos around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is overflowing, and she’s just drying that same plate over and over.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kids are being so sneaky, and she has no idea.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is standing on that stool like it’s the most natural thing in the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I’m impressed by his balance, but I’m also terrified he’s going to fall.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just waiting, her eyes fixed on the cookie jar.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if they’ve planned this whole thing out.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is spreading, and the woman is still just standing there.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how calm she is while everything is falling apart.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This scene is both frustrating and hilarious at the same time.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I don’t know whether to laugh or yell at someone to do something.
segments.speaker: PAR
